Lack enough support: The claim does not provide evidence or sources to support the assertion that Gov. John Kasich can remove the president of the State Board of Education.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Gov. John Kasich has the power to remove the president of the State Board of Education without providing any evidence or legal basis for this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Gov. John Kasich stated he saw no need for further action regarding the controversy surrounding the president of the State Board of Education.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing a clear and well-supported argument or explanation for the assertion made.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential consequences or implications of Gov. John Kasich removing the president of the State Board of Education, as it does not explore the potential impact on the education system or the political landscape.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or perspectives regarding the power and authority of Gov. John Kasich in relation to the State Board of Education.
